how are you.definition: a greeting asking about someone's wellbeing

what's up.definition: informal greeting; asking how someone is
examples: Hey, what's up?
What's up with you lately?

how's it going.definition: informal greeting asking how someone is
examples: Hey, how's it going?

nice to meet you.definition: polite phrase when meeting someone for the first time

long time no see.definition: greeting used when you haven't seen someone in a while

examples: See you later!
Goodbye, take care!

have a good one.definition: casual farewell wishing a good day
examples: See you tomorrow. Have a good one!

never mind.definition: dismissing something as unimportant; forget about it

examples: No worries, happy to help.
Oh, my bad. I didn't see you there.
'Thanks for your help!' 'No problem.'

excuse me.definition: polite way to get attention or apologize for minor inconvenience

pardon me.definition: formal excuse me; asking for repetition

examples: No way! You got the job?
No way that's real.

I feel you.definition: I understand and empathize with you

examples: At the end of the day, family is what matters.

as far as I know.definition: to the best of my knowledge

I couldn't care less.note: often incorrectly said as 'I could care less'

what the hell.definition: expression of surprise, frustration, or disbelief
examples: What the hell happened here?

what the fuck.definition: expressing strong shock, confusion, or frustration

oh my god.definition: exclamation of surprise, shock, or emphasis
examples: Oh my God, I can't believe it!

shut up.definition: expression of surprise/disbelief (informal); also command to be quiet
examples: Shut up! She's dating him?
Give me a break! That's ridiculous.

get out of here.definition: expression of disbelief; also literal command to leave
examples: Get out of here! You won the lottery?

I can't even.definition: unable to process/deal with something (often humorous)

that hits different.definition: something affects you in a unique or profound way

slay.definition: to do something exceptionally well; look amazing

lit.definition: exciting, fun, or excellent; also: intoxicated

lowkey.definition: secretly; somewhat; to a small degree

clutch.definition: performing well under pressure; exactly what's needed

sus.origin: shortened form, popularized by Among Us

vibe.definition: atmosphere; feeling; to relax and enjoy

rent free.definition: constantly thinking about something without wanting to
rent free.example: living in my head rent free

touch grass.definition: go outside; take a break from the internet

based.definition: having opinions without caring what others think; admirable

simp.definition: someone who does too much for someone they like

stan.definition: obsessive fan; to be an obsessive fan of

same.definition: I relate to that; me too

period.definition: end of discussion; emphasizing a point

say less.definition: I understand; you don't need to explain more

main character.definition: someone acting like they're the protagonist of life

ick.definition: sudden feeling of disgust or turn-off

gaslighting.definition: manipulating someone into questioning their reality

breadcrumbing.definition: giving someone just enough attention to keep them interested

examples: You're performing tonight? Break a leg!
That car cost an arm and a leg.
It's late, I'm going to hit the sack.

on the same page.definition: in agreement; having the same understanding
examples: Let's make sure we're on the same page.
That didn't work. Back to square one.
He'll apologize when pigs fly.

speak of the devil.definition: said when someone you were just talking about appears

a blessing in disguise.definition: something bad that turns out to be good

kill two birds with one stone.definition: accomplish two things with one action

examples: He visits once in a blue moon.

the elephant in the room.definition: obvious problem no one wants to discuss

examples: You're kidding! She really said that?
You're joking! That can't be true.
Holy cow! Look at the size of that fish!
Holy smokes! That was close!

oh my gosh.definition: exclamation of surprise (milder than 'oh my god')
examples: Oh my gosh, that's amazing!
What the heck is going on here?
What on earth are you doing?
For crying out loud, just pick one!
Good grief! Another meeting?
Good heavens! What happened to you?
Blimey! That's expensive!
Crikey! Look at that spider!

bloody hell.definition: British exclamation of surprise, frustration, or emphasis
examples: Bloody hell! That was close!

what's going on.definition: asking about the current situation or greeting
examples: What's going on?
What's going on with you?
How are you doing today?
Long time no see! What have you been up to?
'How's work?' 'Same old same old.'
'What's up?' 'Not much, just hanging out.'
'How are you?' 'Can't complain.'

keeping busy.definition: staying occupied with work or activities
examples: Just keeping busy with work.
How are you? Hanging in there.
Gotta go, catch you later!
Alright, take it easy!
Alright, peace out!
Okay, later!

cheers.definition: British farewell; also toast; also thanks
examples: Cheers, see you next week!
Ta-ta for now!
I hear you, that sounds frustrating.
'Can you help?' 'You bet!'

you got it.definition: expression of agreement to do something
examples: 'Can you send that file?' 'You got it!'
'Can you pick me up?' 'Sure thing.'
Fair enough, we'll do it your way.
'Meet at 7?' 'Sounds good.'
Friday works for me.
'That was exhausting.' 'You can say that again!'
'This traffic is awful.' 'Tell me about it!'
'She's talented.' 'I'll say!'
No way Jose, I'm not doing that!
Fat chance of that happening!
'I'll beat you.' 'In your dreams!'
'Will you lend him money?' 'Not on your life!'

over my dead body.definition: emphatic refusal (I'll prevent it at all costs)
examples: Over my dead body will he get that promotion!
'I can run a marathon.' 'Yeah, right.'
Get real, that plan will never work.
'I'll be rich someday.' 'Dream on!'
You should apply for that job. Go for it!
Don't worry about the interview. You've got this!

you can do it.definition: encouragement expressing belief in someone's ability
examples: Come on, you can do it!
Things will get better. Hang in there!
Great work! Keep it up!
Don't get discouraged. Keep your chin up!
Your presentation will be great. Knock 'em dead!
I screwed up, I'm sorry.
I really messed up this time.
My mistake, I'll fix it.

I owe you one.definition: I'm indebted to you for a favor
examples: Thanks for covering my shift. I owe you one.
'Why did she leave?' 'Beats me.'
'Where did he go?' 'Search me.'
'What's going to happen?' 'Your guess is as good as mine.'
Who knows what will happen next?
God only knows where he went.
Heaven knows I tried my best.

it depends.definition: the answer varies based on circumstances
examples: 'Will you come?' 'It depends on the weather.'
'Can we go?' 'We'll see.'

don't quote me on that.definition: I'm not certain; don't hold me to this
examples: I think it's Tuesday, but don't quote me on that.
If memory serves, we met in 2010.

do you mind.definition: polite way to ask if something bothers someone or to make a request
examples: Do you mind if I sit here?
Would you mind closing the door?
Could you please help me with this?

if you don't mind.definition: polite way to make a request
examples: I'll take the window seat, if you don't mind.
If it's not too much trouble, could you review this?
I'll be there in no time.
I'll fix that in a jiffy.
Just a sec, I'll be right there.
Hold on, let me check.
Hang on, I'm almost done.
Give me a minute to finish this.
When push comes to shove, she always comes through.
Sooner or later, the truth will come out.

better late than never.definition: it's better to do something late than not at all
examples: You finally called! Better late than never.
She'd help you at the drop of a hat.

break the bank.definition: cost a lot of money; exhaust one's funds
examples: We want a nice dinner, but nothing that will break the bank.

a dime a dozen.definition: very common and therefore not valuable
examples: Those souvenirs are a dime a dozen.

penny for your thoughts.definition: asking what someone is thinking about
examples: You look thoughtful. Penny for your thoughts?
Here's my two cents: don't do it.

put your money where your mouth is.definition: back up your words with action
examples: You say you're good? Put your money where your mouth is.
Break's over. Back to the grind.

the bottom line.definition: the final result; the most important point
examples: The bottom line is we need more sales.
Let's get the ball rolling on this project.
We need to think outside the box on this one.
She went the whole nine yards for the wedding.
He does everything by the book.
The party got out of hand.
I got carried away with the shopping.
Pull yourself together and focus.
Cut it out, you're being annoying.
Knock it off! I'm trying to work.
I've never tried sushi, but I'll give it a shot.
Let me give it a go.
I'm tired. Time to hit the hay.

call it a day.definition: stop working; finish for the day
examples: Let's call it a day and go home.
After three hours, they called it quits.

i can't even.transliteration: ya ne mogu, u menya net slov
i can't even.definition: я не могу, у меня нет слов

i would like.transliteration: ya khotel by... / ya khotela by...
i would like.definition: я хотел бы... / я хотела бы...

the early bird catches the worm.transliteration: kto rano vstayot, tomu Bog podayot
the early bird catches the worm.definition: кто рано встаёт, тому Бог подаёт

all that glitters is not gold.transliteration: ne vsyo to zoloto, chto blestit
all that glitters is not gold.definition: не всё то золото, что блестит

when in rome do as the romans do.transliteration: v chuzhoy monastyr so svoim ustavom ne khodyat
when in rome do as the romans do.definition: в чужой монастырь со своим уставом не ходят

there's no place like home.transliteration: v gostyakh khorosho, a doma luchshe
there's no place like home.definition: в гостях хорошо, а дома лучше

you can't have your cake and eat it too.transliteration: i volki syty, i ovtsy tsely
you can't have your cake and eat it too.definition: и волки сыты, и овцы целы

once bitten twice shy.transliteration: obzhyogshis na moloke, duyesh na vodu
once bitten twice shy.definition: обжёгшись на молоке, дуешь на воду

too many cooks spoil the broth.transliteration: u semi nyanek ditya bez glaza
too many cooks spoil the broth.definition: у семи нянек дитя без глаза

look before you leap.transliteration: sem raz otmer, odin raz otrezh
look before you leap.definition: семь раз отмерь, один раз отрежь

a rolling stone gathers no moss.transliteration: pod lezhachiy kamen voda ne techyot
a rolling stone gathers no moss.definition: под лежачий камень вода не течёт

if you chase two rabbits you will catch.transliteration: za dvumya zaytsami pogonishsya — ni odnogo ne poymayesh
if you chase two rabbits you will catch.definition: за двумя зайцами погонишься — ни одного не поймаешь
